## Two-Stage CI/CD

### Stage 1: GitHub Actions (Infrastructure & Quality)

**Purpose:** Validate code, manage infrastructure, ensure quality

**Responsibilities:**
- âœ… Code linting and formatting
- âœ… Type checking
- âœ… Build validation
- âœ… Terraform infrastructure management
- âœ… Security scanning
- âœ… Broken link detection

**Triggers:**
- Pull requests
- Pushes to main

**Duration:** ~3-5 minutes

### Stage 2: AWS Amplify (Application Deployment)

**Purpose:** Build and deploy the actual application

**Responsibilities:**
- âœ… Install dependencies
- âœ… Build Next.js application
- âœ… Optimize assets
- âœ… Deploy to CDN
- âœ… Invalidate cache
- âœ… Serve traffic

**Triggers:**
- Pushes to main (automatic)
- Manual triggers
- Webhook events

**Duration:** ~5-8 minutes

## Failure Handling

### GitHub Actions Failure

```
PR Check Fails
     â†“
âŒ Blocks merge
     â†“
Developer fixes code
     â†“
Pushes new commit
     â†“
Re-runs checks
     â†“
âœ… Passes â†’ Ready to merge
```

### Terraform Apply Failure

```
Terraform Apply Fails
     â†“
âŒ Stops deployment
     â†“
Creates GitHub issue
     â†“
Sends alert notification
     â†“
Manual investigation required
     â†“
Fix and re-run
```

### AWS Amplify Build Failure

```
Amplify Build Fails
     â†“
âŒ Deployment aborted
     â†“
Previous version still live
     â†“
Build logs available
     â†“
Developer fixes issue
     â†“
Push new commit
     â†“
Auto-retry build
```

## Security Flow

```
Developer â†’ GitHub â†’ AWS
             â†‘         â†‘
             â”‚         â”‚
        GitHub      AWS IAM
        Secrets     Roles
             â”‚         â”‚
        Protected  Protected
```

**Security Layers:**
1. âœ… GitHub repository access control
2. âœ… GitHub Secrets encryption
3. âœ… AWS IAM role permissions
4. âœ… GitHub Environment protection
5. âœ… Branch protection rules
6. âœ… Required code reviews

## Rollback Strategy

### Option 1: Git Revert
```bash
git revert <commit-hash>
git push origin main
# Triggers automatic rebuild
```

### Option 2: AWS Amplify Console
```
1. Go to AWS Amplify Console
2. Select your app
3. Click "Redeploy this version" on previous build
```

### Option 3: Terraform State
```bash
cd terraform
terraform state pull > backup.tfstate
# Restore if needed
terraform state push backup.tfstate
```

## Cost Breakdown

### GitHub Actions (Free Tier)
- âœ… 2,000 minutes/month (public repos)
- âœ… 500 MB storage
- âœ… Unlimited for public repos

### AWS Amplify (~$5-20/month)
- Build minutes: $0.01/minute
- Hosting: $0.15/GB stored + $0.15/GB served
- First 1,000 build minutes free
- First 15 GB served free

### Total Estimated Cost
- **Small docs site:** $5-10/month
- **Medium traffic:** $10-20/month
- **High traffic:** $20-50/month

## Performance Metrics

**Typical Timings:**
- PR validation: 3-5 minutes
- Terraform apply: 1-3 minutes
- Amplify build: 5-8 minutes
- **Total merge to live:** ~10-15 minutes

**Optimization Tips:**
- Use npm caching (âœ… already configured)
- Parallel job execution (âœ… already configured)
- Incremental builds where possible
